positive_review: I liked the process of applying which is very simple and efficient. The database of companies/opportunities is good if you're looking for small to medium-sized companies. I wish the team the best of luck with the incredible work they are doing acting as a trusted "connector". The entire process took me about two weeks. Also, love that you get notifications about the progress of your application. For example, each time your application is viewed and other notifications or updates regarding the applicationReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: Sometimes right after applying to a job, that position gets closed. positive_review: I would say that the jobs sent to me are very relevant to my experience and I probably apply to 50% of those sent to me. I like the quick response and engagement info when an employer has looked at my resume too.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: At times the jobs are not relevant at all or too junior, almost as if Ai took over the assessment and only focused on one keyword.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: I like the quick apply process and then being matched automatically to other jobs similar. But at times the matching job recommendations are not relevant or too junior since the match may be for one key word related to me. For example, I'm seeking a senior marketing and communication executive position. Many times I get jobs that have the word "marketing" in the title but have nothing to do with what I'm looking for.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: I like being able to access my resume and copy it/download it. I like how easy it is to apply for jobs and that you can apply to multiple at once. I like that you can swipe left on jobs to hide them. I like that you can easily apply on a company's website. The search function is good. I've had a few recruiters reach out to me and mention that they saw me on here so that makes me feel like my resume is actually being sent to people or showing up in searches versus like on Indeed where I feel like I'm just sitting out there and I don't get contacted by people from there nearly as much.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: For me, it would be nice to save search preferences. Because I don't know if it's because my resume sucks or that I'm super entry level but I don't like how many jobs are for sales positions. I try to swipe right or dismiss as many as I can but I feel like they are VERY common on here versus on Indeed. I guess it makes sense on your guys' end because I'm sure sales companies are always desperate for people so it's not really your guys' fault. It could also be the area that I'm in that there's so many shady pyramid scheme-like "marketing" or "advertising" agencies.I don't think my issue is really ZipRecruiter's fault but there are so many crappy advertising agencies with misleading headlines & descriptions. I feel like they try to game the algorithm by adding words that someone like me would search for. Like for example, the job title will be "Marketing Admin Assistant" and the description will say things like, "people who have experience with HR, Human Resources, Administrative Assistance, Office Environment, Management," etc. just to show up in an HR job search, BUT it will basically be door-to-door sales. Like,Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: And also like it's so easy to apply to the jobs that sometimes I accidentally apply for sales jobs and then I'm like "oops. oh well" because they are really aggressive anyways with their hiring tactic because I guess they're desperate but either it has increased my overall confidence. I don't know if that's a good thing for them or you guys but it has helped me.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: I like how Zip Recruiter allows me to view only the positions that match me instead of the ad-filled, cluttered websites many other job board sites have. I don't have to type in my individual work history like many of these low-tier HTML sites make you do, I just plug in my important information and a copy of my resume and potential employers can connect with me more quickly.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: I think any job board site has room for improvement in ensuring that older postings get deleted on a cycle so no one wastes their time applying to positions that have already been filled. There's also always room to add more filters for job searches to better tailor results.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: Zip Recruiter has given me hope in my job search. I recently moved to a new city and have been struggling with finding opportunities in the specific areas of work I'd like to take my career path towards, and Zip Recruiter has shown me an easy way to see all of these previously hidden opportunities in front of me.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: ZipRecruiter offers summaries of the filters based on date, background, place, etc, so the candidate's database can be navigated easily which removes the lengthy efforts we have to do with each nominee. negative_review: ZipRecruiter's internal server is somewhat unusual and is lacking of good and practical search capabilities. Also, I wish ZipRecruiter could have an option where it could call those that have served for two years or more and put them first on the list to be filled, as well as delete or cover applications from years ago we don't intend to call.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: ZipRecruiter encourages us to reach for many qualified applicants to our workplace for an accessible interview, which includes the recruitment of new hires and the supervision of the recruitment process. It has been really helpful to find people who are available for our roles, such as accountants and development managers.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: I love the feedback more than any other feature. I know if my application has been reviewed and the likelihood of being considered seriously. negative_review: The salary request feature is too easy to accidentally mark and may leave an employer uninterested in a candidate. I rarely have received a response after the request feature was initiated.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: Standardization so that you do not need to create a profile on 40 different sites in order to send out resumes. Also, the workflow is very intuitive.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: I find that I do not need as many email updates as are sent every time my resume is uploaded to a new company.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: I hate applying for jobs and this makes it a little easier.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: Whenever we want to identify qualified applicants for our clients, our companies use ZipRecruiter for free job orders, as it gives us the capability to see all contact details. The application is very simple to use and is subject to a lot of summaries.  You are more interested in getting the work out of view or providing direct answers to your position rather than building a massive list of applicants. Also, it's also able to deliver Vets Services, with vets or applicants in transition seeking positions in which they are accessible.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: Being honest, there's nothing I dislike about ZipRecruiter. I definitely give it a 10 because I feel it's almost perfect.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: We use ZipRecruiter to analyze our ATS system and link it, allowing monitoring data and contestant profiles simpler. It works as a work council for our different open posts and also as a great source point for reactive applicants in their very own online database. It provides us with another framework for nominees if in our administrative pool we don't have enough.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: ZipRecruiter allows me to find exactly what I love to do. positive_review: I enjoy that Zipcruiter allows you to one-click apply for a plethora of opportunities. I also enjoy that you could cater the platform to specific types of jobs that you are looking for. It's really encouraging when you receive e-mails with new and live positions that I could apply for. I also like that it allows you to build your own profile where you can market yourself to employers.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: I dislike that certain jobs may stay live longer than need be. Once a position anywhere is filled the listing should close. There should be some algorithm to make this possible. For example, I once applied to several amount of positions and came to the realization that employers weren't reviewing all the applications coming in. I learned this because I was told at my current job that this outlet is used as a worst-case scenario. So in those terms I was lucky. I also learned this through applying to a certain position to only find out that the business has been closed for months. There needs to be a way to make sure employers are accountable for replying to candidates who are interested in the position.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: ZipRecruiter is helping me become a more detail-oriented individual. The benefits are that it has inspired me to put myself out there on more professional outlets. I also like that the home page lists all the recent job postings that cater to what you are looking for.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: Like a lot of other job boards you set up a profile and you will get emails or notifications that you match a job. However, with ZipRecruiter you have the option of one-click apply. This is an awesome feature that saves time and you can apply to a lot of different jobs in a short amount of time. The process of setting up your profile is easy and it helps guide you through it. It also gives you pointers on how to make you stand out.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: Something I don't like is you will get a lot of jobs that have nothing to do with your background. Or you will get a notification that a job is a great fit, and you don't meet the requirements. Sometimes this will happen a few days in a row and it makes it's hard to filter through what is a good match and what is not. Other than that I don't have any other complaints about ZipRecruiter.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: Some of the problems that ZipRecruiter has helped me with is, finding jobs. I know that sounds simple, but trying to find jobs out there is kind of hard when you don't know where to look. ZipRecruiter has made it easy to find them, more like they show you a list of jobs. One of my problems when I first started job hunting was not knowing where to look and ZipRecruiter has solved that for me.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

negative_review: I would like to see an upload location on your profile for a Cover Letter. I think that the email marketing can be over bearing at times, keep emails coming but make sure they are very specific and that there is more purpose behind them.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: It has been an easy way for me to get all of my information in one location for employers to find me. I am trying to get into a new career field and ZipRecruiter is platform that is helping take my dream and making it a reality.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

negative_review: I haven't seen any yet as I am new the website. positive_review: The platform is very user-friendly. It felt easy to navigate and fill in the information requested. I also really liked the design and colors. It made me feel like a game. negative_review: Maybe too many messages. And maybe some positions feel like pyramid schemes or not genuine enough, but you will only discover that after interviews. problems_solved: Well, It has helped me move my energies towards my goal of finding a job. It helps me understand what the employers are looking for. Also, it makes me feel closer to employers around me and where I am located.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

problems_solved: Thank you for your feedback. We apologize for any frustration that was caused. Our hiring pause is an optional plan. In the cancelation of your job slot subscription, alternatively, downgrading to the hiring pause allows continued access to select features. We are confident that our billing team was able to assist you when you called. However, if you have any other questions, please don't hesitate to reach out to us. We are available 24/7 at 877-252-1062 and we are always happy to help. Best regards. ~DW

positive_review: Zip Recruiter is designed to help people from diverse backgrounds, skill set, education, and experience to narrow down their desired field of employment. negative_review: Recommended jobs should be aligned better with education and experience of candidates. For example, if you have management experience the recommended jobs show entry level positions, instead of tenure experience, education, and skills.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: I have benefited from Zip Recruiter personally and professionally. I highly recommend this site. positive_review: I love how easy and transparent it is to apply, search, and find jobs. I have now found three fulfilling jobs i've found thanks to zip recruiter. One job I didn't even have to apply to, they found my profile and contacted me. There is always daily updates on my feed of new jobs and ones that I may like based on my experience, giving me opportunity to expand my work experience.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: In my profession, I am in a hiring role. I have found that so many applicants through zip recruiter either have no clue they've applied or just scrolled down and clicked apply, apply, apply blindly hoping to catch something. I'm not sure how this would be fixed but it's a bit of a time waster when contacting applicants. Perhaps not removing one click apply altogether but requiring a little more effort and awareness on the part of the candidate. I can't tell you how many times i've called applicants and they don't even know they've applied.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: I'm in the process of hiring a zip recruiter applicant. I love being notified when a candidate that could be a good fit is clearly set out above the rest.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: I love how ZipRecruiter streamlines the communication process between employer and potential employee! negative_review: The one thing that I would change is that I wish ZipRecruiter would allow you to customize job searches based on the time of type work you want to do within a specific field (ie. problems_solved: I work as a government contractor and I am often looking for new opportunities. With ZipRecruiter's job notifications, I have greatly cut down the amount of time I have to spend scouring the internet for new opportunities. Not only am I saving time not scouring the internet and various job boards, but the screening process has been considerably reduced. I no longer have to wait weeks on end for feedback from my potential employer and ZipRecruiter even notifies me when the employer has looked at my resume, which gives me a general idea of their interest in me as a candidate!Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: What I truly love about ZipRecruiter is that it does what no other job search site does - it allows you to upload your resume and let companies come to you! This is perfect for the person who does not have time to be actively applying constantly, but is interested in new opportunities. I have found that other platforms that claim to do the same simply do not work as well. I get much more contact from recruiters through ZR than anywhere else.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: The only downside of ziprecruiter is that, like many other job platforms, my resume often matches with jobs in the same field as me (healthcare) but they are not jobs I qualify for. problems_solved: Every job I have ever gotten in the last 3 years has been from ZipRecruiter. negative_review: Inability to filter candidates based upon previous/relevant designations. The system takes a lot of ratings to improve suggestions. It lets you know how many people have applied for the position through ziprecruiter. It also lets you know when the job is no longer available. problems_solved: I have been in my current  job for nearly 2 years now and absolutely LOVE what I am doing, but wouldn't have searched for this particular position on my own. However, ZipRecruiter recognized a few key elements on my resume that they suggested might make me a good fit. Fortunately my employer agreed! I also used ZipRecruiter to find my last job. I applied for one position they had listed and then the HR manager at that company called and said "We have actually decided to do away with the position you originally applied for, but reading your resume... I have another position available that you may really be better suited for." She sent me the job description on that Wednesday evening. I interviewed that Friday and started work the following Monday.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

negative_review: With the newest changes to ZipRecruiter, it is becoming increasingly expensive to place ads for the response rates reveived. There are repetitive sales calls and demands for follow-up calls pushing you to purchase more add ons like boosts and bigger ad packages. Now they are changing their service again and have begun charging for the invite to apply. They are making their service even more expensive for people in order actually to attract candidates. To me, they are quickly moving to a point where the value in their basic general ads and resume database is not worth the expense. Also, you get tons of candidates nowhere near qualified for the ad you placed in both applicants and suggested applicants to invite to apply.

positive_review: I like that my information is saved to my profile, so it makes applying for multiple jobs a quick and easy process. From my dashboard, I can look at salaries,messages, available jobs, positions that I have applied for, and those that I have saved for later. This is especially helpful when you are perusing positions, yet don't have the time to research the company or actually send an application. I also like that I can set notifications to let me know when positions that match my qualifications and interests are posted. The ability to use a mobile app also makes it very convenient to check on jobs, see updates to applications, and to return messages in a timely manner. The notifications on the dashboard make it clear when I have action items that I need to take care of related to jobs, or when there are new positions posted that match my needs.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: I like that you can view people's resumes without needing them to approve your request. Other job boards make you email people, and they have to allow you to view their information. I understand this idea, but sometimes people miss the emails or forget to check their accounts. On ZipRecruiter, you can see their phone number and emails, making it easy to reach out. I have spoken to people who were thrilled to hear from me but completely forgot they had a ZipRecruiter account! I also like that you can see the last time someone updated their resume.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: I do not think the filters always produce the best results. Sometimes, I'll put a job title in, and the people who show up do not match the job title at all. For example, I've put "manufacturing manager" in the search and have gotten results with people who have been "science teachers." I am not sure how this happens, but it can be frustrating to dig through results with irrelevant people.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: As a recruiter, I need access to top talent. ZipRecruiter allows me to see millions of resumes. I am helping people who are actively looking for jobs. Sometimes, I log on and see someone who posted their resume a day or two earlier, call them and get them an interview at a company. This feature of knowing when people updated their profile is a huge benefit, as it can tell me who is newly seeking jobs and therefore will be more likely to answer my call or email.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: With ZipRecruiter, finding a job online was never difficult . With just one click, we can post our jobs to all of the main job sites. There's no need to juggle passwords or e-mail addresses. If you're looking for a simple way to manage a recruitment firm, try ZipRecruiter. ZipRecruiter provides the greatest job-search tools because it classifies positions by job title. The website offers a unique dashboard that makes it simple to keep track of all the positions that have been applied for.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: There are no regrets for me by using Zip Recruiter, It made my work so efficient and easier.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: Multiple resumes can be stored under a personal account.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: ZipRecruiter is the smartest way to hire candidates for companies. It’s quick and easy to post our job requirement on ZipRecruiter’s large number of job boards and various social networks available to employers. And with the email alert program of ZipRecruiter, we can easily find qualified candidates to our client organization. Online job search just got better with ZipRecruiter. Post our jobs to all the top job sites, all at once, with just one click. No juggling passwords or e-mail addresses. Try ZipRecruiter for a recruitment agency to run business easily.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: It is good software for Recruiters to manage jobs and find candidates easily. Get the right candidates and post job listings.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
problems_solved: ZipRecruiter makes it easy to hire top talent. List jobs on 100+ job boards with 1 click, then let use smart technology to find the best candidates by matching their skills to our job's requirements. Send job alerts by email, text message or social media to find the perfect candidate fast. We can easily find jobs and candidates fast. Set up email alerts and ZipRecruiter will monitor thousands of job boards and send alerts for jobs that match skills and location. It's like having a personal recruiter for a job consultant. ZipRecruiter's easy-to-use, mobile friendly platform that allows to search, screen and manage applicants all in one place. No more switching between multiple tabs or websites, everything we need is in one neatly organized dashboard.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

positive_review: ZipRecruiter is excellent to get new staff or a job according to your needs, has the feature to complete a profile and upload a resume. But nevertheless, it has some really excellent outstanding features. The suggested and adapted job notifications seem to be really in line with the types of positions that are appropriate based on recent searches or keywords. Too often, job alerts from other job search sites are a bit removed from what the intended search goal is. The function that I like the most is notifications that notify you if your CV has been viewed or if a viewer has given a go. In addition, the metrics that are offered when you see a resume several times are excellent. For example, an alert may say "Your resume was seen a second time, only 25% of applicants have a second hearing." I think this helps applicants to maintain a positive outlook and reuse the product. With other job search sites, after sending a resume, you stay in the dark. To make matters worse, this information is available if you use the website or the mobile application ZipRecruiter. I use the Android version of the application, and the ZipRecruiter notifications are notifications that I look forward to.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
negative_review: ZipRecruiter offers a fairly complete job search product, and it's my favorite. If there was an area for improvement, I'd say it's the references section. It would be nice to be able to link to existing references and transfer them (for example, through Linkedin) or copy and paste a reference with contact information for verification as an additional option instead of having the option to request a reference.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
